title: Ticket #4872: Add ecryptfs-utils as dependency to binary packaging
description: The encrypt_execute_directory enhancements for Linux added in #4856 will expect at run time to find the command-line tool ecryptfs-add-passphrase installed on the machine in a secure place (i.e. /usr/bin, /bin, /sbin, etc). On red hat systems, this tool lives in the rpm package ecryptfs-utils. I think this is also true of Debian. As this package is only ~250KB, and is not likely to conflict with anything, it seems sensible to add package ecryptfs-utils as a dependency to the HTCondor binary RPMs and DEB packages. Note that this package is only needed at run time, it is not needed at build time.
remarks:

Unfortunately, ecryptfs-utils was dropped from Red Hat 7. So, no support in for encrypted execute directory in RHEL 7 and clones.
